question.title: new verison of chromedriver returns org.openqa.selenium.SessionNotCreatedException: Could not start a new session
question.body:
I moved the application to a new server and now the following error occurs every time you use selenium

e=org.openqa.selenium.SessionNotCreatedException: Could not start a new session. Response code 500. Message: session not created: probably user data directory is already in use, please specify a unique value for --user-data-dir argument, or don't use --user-data-dir

Google Chrome 140.0.7339.127 ChromeDriver 140.0.7339.207 group: 'org.seleniumhq.selenium', name: 'selenium-java', version: '4.13.0'

        System.setProperty("webdriver.chrome.driver", chromeDriverPath) ChromeDriverService driverService= ChromeDriverService.createDefaultService() 
ChromeOptions options = prepareOptions() 
WebDriver driver = new ChromeDriver(driverService, options) 
try { return crawl.apply(driver) 
} finally { 
driver.close() driver.quit() driverService.stop() 
}

private ChromeOptions prepareOptions() { ChromeOptions chromeOptions = new ChromeOptions() chromeOptions.addArguments("--headless=new") 
// modified, was just --headless 
chromeOptions.addArguments("user-agent=Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/87.0.4280.88 Safari/537.36") 
chromeOptions.addArguments("--window-size=1920,1080") chromeOptions.addArguments('--no-sandbox') // also added
    
return chromeOptions
}

UPDATE:

I have now added these options and it has led to another error.

chromeOptions.addArguments("--incognito") chromeOptions.addArguments("--user-data-dir=/tmp/profiles")

org.openqa.selenium.SessionNotCreatedException: Could not start a new session. Response code 500. Message: session not created from unknown error: cannot create default profile directory

UPDATE 2: It's happens again))

question_comments.body: not real sure why you are creating a service there either.  I'd simplify things by using no options/service first... ex: WebDriver driver = new ChromeDriver();  If the exception is still thrown there's probably some permissions issues when launching the browser.

the try/finally bit there looks odd.  Returning ? in try, and then calling finally?  Your "finally" will probably run before you return anything... which means you'll close the browser, quit the driver, etc...  Not sure that explains your exception though.  Check to be sure you can run the browser manually.

@ozkanpakdil Thanks for the link. I can't share the entire config because there's too much, but the selenium version is ext['selenium.version'] = '4.13.0'. If we talking about OS, it was Centos 7 and now it's AlmaLinux 9.6.
According to stackoverflow.com/questions/71571616/… this can cme from anything, if you share the pom and reproducer, it would be easier to investigate.
